conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls show height and thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, interior volumes read as rooms, and the roof/ceiling is removed to expose the layout.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall thickness, readable room volumes, clean corner geometry, and a proper cutaway. Minor simplification in some wall/trim details.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches the 2D plan well (garage at right, large living to center-right, kitchen central, bedroom wing to left). Some exterior/edge spaces (alfresco/verandah/portico) appear omitted or not clearly modeled, and a few internal partitions/openings look simplified relative to the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: beds in bedrooms, living seating/dining, kitchen island/appliances, bathroom fixtures. Placement generally aligns with expected room functions; a few items are generic/simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good readability of walls/floors/openings and adequate lighting. No major mesh breaks or UI/text contamination; materials are consistent and background is uncluttered.

detected_errors.description: Exterior/outdoor program from the 2D plan (notably alfresco/verandah/portico) is not clearly represented in the 3D model, suggesting partial scope omission or cropping.
Some door/window placements and opening proportions appear simplified versus the 2D plan (not all openings are clearly verifiable wall-by-wall).
Furniture is largely correct but remains generic; a few room-specific identity cues (e.g., theatre/study detailing) are not strongly distinguished.

summary: A true, clean cutaway 3D conversion with strong spatial readability and generally faithful internal layout, but with some exterior spaces and opening details simplified or missing.
